answerText: The Countess of Pembroke's Arcadia [or Old Arcadia][10] That work's author wrote this collection which includes the line, "'Fool' said my Muse to me, 'look in thy heart and write.'" This sequence of 108 sonnets, titled for a star-lover and a star, is about its author's lover Penelope Rich.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 14 - Finals 2 | 4 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Dametas discovers that Cleophila was a cross-dressing imposter in this work when Cleophila gets in bed with Philoclea. For 10 points each: [10] Name this work in which Pyrocles and Musidorus pursue Duke Basilius's daughters Philoclea and Pamela and end up marrying them.
